data.title: Path editor plugin not working
data.body: Path editor plugin is [currently disabled](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/5b3709d3096df737b8bb2344446be818b0389bfe/editor/plugins/path_editor_plugin.cpp) with `#if 0`.

data.title: Fix 2D-editor mouse wheel zoom for x11.
data.body: Let it zoom again after the InputEvent changes 5b3709d3096df737b8bb2344446be818b0389bfe .

data.title: [GDNative] fixed some functions that returned references
data.body: Those errors were introduced with #8821 (6fd217d). These functions need to return reference types, otherwise setting values on those containers does not work.

data.title: Windows Build Fails - Missing include file
data.body:
Latest Godot version as of today (May 23rd 2017)

godot/editor/editor_initialize_ssl.cpp tries to include file _certs_compressed.h_ which is not available.

data.title: Request: WORLD_NORMAL for vertex shader.
data.body:
**Feature Request:**
Would be very nice to have simplified vertex access to the world space normal when writing shaders.
So we can have: NORMAL, SRC_NORMAL, WORLD_NORMAL.

One great use for the world space normal is dynamic landscape/enviroment texturing and dynamic model texture interaction with the landscape/enviroment.

data.title: Fix UWP compilation issues
data.body:
Also fix VS2017 compilation problems.

Solve part of #8849.
Fix #8845.

data.title: Fix crash when interacting with the 2d editor
data.body:
It was caused by a typo from 5b3709d3096df737b8bb2344446be818b0389bfe.

This issue was cited in https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/8874#issuecomment-303392647

data.title: Old logo still used in some places
data.body:
519df0d34d823601b98e8e1838ee726a7801c248 fixed the logo almost everywhere, but it missed some places:

| Description | Location |
| --- | --- |
| Windows executable icon | `platform/windows/godot.ico` |
| UWP template images | `misc/dist/uwp_template/Assets/*.png` |
| OSX app template icon | `misc/dist/osx_template.app/Contents/Resources/icon.icns` |
| OSX editor app icon | `misc/dist/osx_tools.app/Contents/Resources/Godot.icns` |

data.title: Make arm64 the default option and set minimum to iOS 9
data.body:
We might even want to consider removing armv7 support all together because compiling and deploying your app like that makes iOS 10 give a nice big message to the user that your app won't run for much longer.

Anyway, I made ARM64 the default if you don't specify any parameters to scons, you can set either bits=32, arch=arm or arch=armv7 to compile 32bit arm and arch=x86 and simulator options work as before.

I haven't used the simulator for awhile, I'll see if I can get those up and running to. It is set to a minimum of iOS 4 which is defunct with all the new stuff we're using.

I also upped the minimum iOS to 9, latest figures give iOS 9 a market of 8 to 9% and iOS 10 a market of 90% leaving a percentile of devices unsupported, but it should allow us to access some of the newer APIs.

data.title: More fixes for iOS Godot 3.0
data.body:
- nicely exit if initialisation fails
- fix a few issues around new event handling
- use 16bit single channel framebuffer as 32bit is not supported on iOS ( @reduz  you'll probably want me to do this differently)

data.title: Fix a few issues compiling windows and using VS2015 and earlier
data.body: Contains the fix suggested in #8822 and a few fixes around input events that were changed but had a few typos

data.title: Make scroll bars look different when pressed
data.body:
Many operating systems (Windows and some Linux desktop environments at least) make scroll bars look different when pressed (in contrast to merely being hovered), in order to be consistent with buttons, for example.

Currently, Godot does not make a visual difference between hovering a scroll bar and pressing it. It could be made so that, in the default editor theme, a presssed scroll bar has the same thickness as when hovered, but with a darker color.

data.title: [3.0] Create new folder SIGSEGV crash.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Xubuntu 17.04, 4.10 kernel.
Latest Godot master - a77e53b.

**Issue description:**
If you press Enter key while creating new folder for new project Godot crashes with SIGSEGV. If OK button is pressed Godot correctly reacts and no crash occurs.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Start Godot -> New Project -> Browse -> Create New Folder -> (insert some text or leave name field empty) -> Press Enter Key -> Godot crashes.

**Link to minimal example project:**
There is no need.

data.title: Add OS.get_screen_metric()
data.body:
Combining OS.get_screen_dpi() with OS.get_screen_size() does not return accurate values for the physical screen dimensions.

Children have IOD's of 6 cm, women in the armed forces have IOD's of 6.2 cm, I have an IOD of 6.35 cm and some giants have IOD's around 7 cm. It's all in a narrow enough range that some error can be tolerated. But screen sizes are not in a narrow range. There are $8 Android devices now with 7.6 cm screens, $25 devices with 11.4 cm screens, and your grandma probably has one with a 15.2 cm screen.

To save players from manually typing things in, any game engine worth its salt should be able to return the physical dimensions of the screen. This would help greatly with mobile VR and would integrate well with related PRs.

I will be indisposed for the next month as work has really caught up with me. This thread serves as a log of mine and others' progress towards getting proper screen size detection in Godot. I am linking [a 2.1 test case](https://github.com/fluffrabbit/TestScreenSize) that does what it can with OS.get_screen_dpi() and OS.get_screen_size().

data.title: Fix PathFollow rotations.
data.body:
Also introduced a few more math checks useful for debugging.

~~Only for getting feedback, not ready for merge yet. The hope is to fix #8848 eventually.~~ Should be good to go if the assumptions I mention below are OK.

(In fact, `det==0`, which was caused by mishandling of null displacements [which then leads to sending two parallel vectors to `Transform::set_look_at`], is not the only issue, it seems PathFollow rotations are broken overall: if you simply draw a curve from (0,0,0) to (0,1,0) to (1,1,0) using the curve editor and make a TestCube follow it, it makes additional spins around the "intersection" (0,1,0)) even in `ROTATION_XYZ` mode.

I'm hoping @reduz can take a look and give some feedback.

data.title: Fix errors on engine startup.
data.body:
Fixes a bunch of the most spammy console errors introduced by recent refactorings:

- `AudioServerState` does not exist, this was the only reference to it in the source. The surrounding code made it clear that `AudioServerLayout` was meant to be used instead.
- `StreamCSVTranslation` same here, it's the only reference. I went with `Translation` here, but I'm not 100% certain.
- Some methods have been moved from `Texture` to `Image`, but the old bindings were still there.
- A few `name == ""` errors related to duplicating nodes.

data.title: Scene minimap for 2D editor
data.body:
A minimap for 2D editor could be really useful for games with big levels.

This is the way it is on Tiled:
![tiledcapture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10215987/26321803/b0e62b44-3efe-11e7-8748-2793faaf17ab.png)

But on Godot it will need to be configurable on extents and zoom, not limited to tilemaps (because is just one of many ways to make levels).

Could look like this:
![minigodotmap](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10215987/26321837/da515cf6-3efe-11e7-816a-fb2371e627db.png)
Or use the bottom panel to make it less intrusive and allow minimaps for huge levels,

This may be possible to do with plugins but I'm not good with viewports (and failed miserably trying :sweat_smile: ) so I can't be sure.

data.title: Suggestion - Splash screen configuration option for minimal display duration
data.body:
**Godot version:3.0**

**Suggestion description:**
A la Unity3D / Unreal Engine and any worthy engine.
A splash screen, intro screen or loading screen.
You know for public exposure/awareness and self-advertising !
A simple skippable black screen with Godot engine logo by default for example.

**Where to offer it ?**
- And a simple checkbox (or droplist with alternative screens...) in build templates.
- and alternatively a customizable node.

data.title: Editor getting unusable after commit c3baf5e on Lubuntu 17.04
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Lubuntu 17.04 (also 16.10) 64bit
Godot from this commit: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/c3baf5eb3cf71c6645e2b721c09d284db0f630b2 and going on.

**Issue description:**
What happened(1): Images loaded as texture/sprite are black squares
What happened (later commits) (2): Create a new project from Project Manager makes godot Crash
What was expected(1): Images should be shown as b69d4eb and previous commits
What was expected(2): Godot should be able to create new project without crash.


**Steps to reproduce:**
for black square:
1. download c3baf5eb3cf71c6645e2b721c09d284db0f630b2 or later commit
2. compile (scons platform=x11) and launch binary
3. create a new project and a new sprite node
4. load the icon.png in the sprite node.
result = black square shown in place of the bitmap

for more recent commit
1.download&compile the latest  commit
2. run godot project manager and create a new project
result = crash when pressing the button [Create] (after creating the directory)



**Link to minimal example project:**
screenshot of the same project running in the two different instances of godot:
https://matrix.org/_matrix/media/v1/download/matrix.org/riHIZCJwKbBemxtmNmUfoEss

link to the compiled binaries:
https://matrix.org/_matrix/media/v1/download/matrix.org/vMRWjGfgXefxjIzHNTZxbdxU

data.title: Collapse the top menus
data.body:
Taking advantage of the current UI changes being done for 3.0, I was thinking that we could also improve the menu buttons on the top.

**Currently, the top-left is occupied by**
- Scene
- Tools
- Export

Tools only have one item, making it actually kind of like a button.
Export is a button, not a menu.

**On the top-right:**
- volume bar?
- settings
- weird icons that nobody understands what they are for :p

I thought in 2 different proposals for a change:

1. Collapse the top-left buttons into just one, maybe call it "Project"?. This means the scene menu will have 2 more items, and we get rid of tools and export, which are seldom used anyway.

2. Since the space is not being used for anything else, make a more functional menu "bar", and split some items into different menus to make things easier to find. I'd also bring the Settings menu on the right, to join the left side. Project settings could be inside it, together with Editor Settings

WDYT? :)

data.title: [2.1] Convert shaders to binary format when exporting
data.body:
When exporting a project with "convert text scenes" option enabled the editor now also convert text shaders (tres/xshd/xml) to binary format (`.shd`).

This does not implement encryption, I can work on it if there is interest.

Partial fix for #8860 .
This does not apply to GraphShaders, only regular text Shaders.

Resource conversion is not supported on 3.0 as far as I know, so I'm proposing this for `2.1`.

It's quite a preliminary patch, but I'd like your comments on encryption and converting graph shaders before implementing it.

data.title: Shaders do not get compiled nor encrypted when exporting
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
2.1.x (tested, but probably 3.0 too)

**Issue description:**
When exporting a project containing a shader saved as a `.tres` file (outside of the scene), the shader gets exported as a text file in the `data.pck`.
I was expecting it to be treated like a script (encrypting it if an encryption key is provided) or at least them to be converted to a binary `.shd` file like it's done with the `.tscn` files that gets converted to a `.scn` file.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create a project containing a shader.
2. Export it
3. Check the data.pck with a text editor, you will see the text shader inside

**Link to minimal example project:**
[text_shader.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1018463/text_shader.zip)

data.title: GDScript standalone
data.body:
Is there any way to use GDScript embed in C++ host.

So we can use same GDScript both client and server.

data.title: Crash because of NULL pointer for input event
data.body:
In [Input_event line 60](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/5b3709d3096df737b8bb2344446be818b0389bfe/core/os/input_event.cpp#L60) the passed Input event is NULL although `this` is a valid input event object.

``` c++
bool InputEvent::is_action(const StringName &p_action) const {

	return InputMap::get_singleton()->event_is_action(Ref<InputEvent>(this), p_action);
}
```
So there is something wrong with this:
```c++
Ref<InputEvent>(this)
```
I think it is an easy fix, I can also do it if someone tells me what the problem is.

data.title: 2D engine without GPU
data.body:
According to slant.co, Godot is now the top 2D game engine https://www.slant.co/topics/341/viewpoints/22/~best-2d-game-engines~godot

It would be even more awesome if 2D engine could run without 3D accelerator.

* CPUs are capable of doing 2D calculations
* proper 2D abstraction without shader dependency allows to cover more platforms such as HTML5 more easily without the burden of OpenGL / Vulcan etc, implementation
* proper 2D abstraction will make Godot useful for future GPU designers
* 2D abstraction will make Godot core useful for integrating into OS rendering layers

These things mean more funding, better performance for specific cases (window management, real-time raster video-rendering, etc.), more attention from low powered devices and high skilled math hackers.
